title: Hepatitis b adult vaccine Side Effects: Common, Severe, Long Term
description: Learn about the side effects of hepatitis b adult vaccine, from common to rare, for consumers and healthcare professionals.
cleaned_text: Hepatitis b adult vaccine Side Effects [Medically reviewed](/support/editorial_policy.html#editorial-staff) by Drugs.com. Last updated on Jul 27, 2023. Applies to [hepatitis b adult vaccine](/mtm/hepatitis-b-adult-vaccine.html): intramuscular solution, intramuscular suspension. Other dosage forms: Serious side effects Along with its needed effects, [hepatitis b](/cg/hepatitis-b.html) adult vaccine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention. Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur while taking hepatitis b adult vaccine: Rare - Chest pain or discomfort - inability to move the arms and legs [nausea](/health-guide/nausea.html) - pain or discomfort in the arms, jaw, back, or neck - sudden numbness and weakness in the arms and legs - sweating [vomiting](/cg/acute-nausea-and-vomiting.html) Incidence not known - Burning, crawling, [itching](/cg/itchy-skin.html), numbness, prickling, "pins and needles", or tingling [difficulty swallowing](/cg/dysphagia.html) - dizziness [fast heartbeat](/cg/tachycardia.html) - hives, itching, skin [rash](/health-guide/rash.html) - puffiness or swelling of the eyelids or around the eyes, face, lips, or tongue - stomach pain - trouble breathing - unusual tiredness or weakness Other side effects Some side effects of hepatitis b adult vaccine may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them: More common - Difficulty in moving - general feeling of discomfort or illness [headache](/cg/tension-headache.html) [joint pain](/cg/osteoarthritis.html) - muscle aches, cramps, pains, or stiffness - pain or tenderness at the injection site - swollen joints Less common [Fever](/health-guide/fever.html) - redness or swelling at the injection site For Healthcare Professionals Applies to hepatitis b adult vaccine: intramuscular solution, intramuscular suspension.
